intro: Mentzelia haenkii, commonly known as the desert blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and grasslands, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are generally narrow and linear, reducing water loss, while its flowers are yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Mentzelia haenkii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar sources in its native habitats.
